title: [Large-scale] Concept Development Promotion Strategies through Peer Argumentation

context.prior_knowledge: Science Curriculum Knowledge, Basic Cooperative Learning Theory, and Understanding of Argumentative Structures
context.additional_context: Customized training program supporting pre-service teachers in systematically analyzing and designing peer argumentation processes on scientific concepts.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze peer argumentation interactions by applying a 4-level argument coding framework.
Learners can propose three strategies for designing collaborative learning activities that promote scientific concept development.
Learners can develop an assessment rubric explaining conceptual changes occurring during peer argumentation.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
